page.title: 17BURWASH CHURCHYARD
page.content: Our churchyard has a winding path that wends its way through the graves. Many gravestones are very old, some are made from marble that glints in the sunlight, there are other areas for family plots where several generations of the one family are buried. It is a very quiet place between the High Street and the School, there is a very old Yew tree, two seats in the lee of the church and many walks start from the edge of the churchyard. There is one grave that is said to have a secret passageway that leads to Bateman's, many of the graves have pretty flowers arranged on them, while others have skull and crossbones inscribed on them, these depict the graves of former smugglers. There are two memorial stones that commemorate the courageous soldiers that died in the First and Second World Wars.
